description:
1. Wraparound cover by Neal Adams and Dick Giordano.
  2. Splash page by Jose Delbo and Joe Orlando.
  3. "The Curse of Krypton!" (Superman and Batman) written by Denny O'Neill, penciled by Jose Garcia Lopez, inked by Dick Giordano, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Ben Oda.
  4. "The Blood of the Lamb!" (Black Lightning and Tobias Whale) written by Denny O'Neill, penciled by Rich Buckler, inked by Romeo Tanghal, colored by Jerry Serpe and lettered by Albert De Guzman.
  5. "One Man Can Cry" (Green Arrow) written by Gerry Conway, penciled by Jose Delbo, inked by Dave Hunt, colored by Jerry Serpe and lettered by Shelly Leferman.
  6. "Death Orbit" (Hawkman and Hawkgirl) written by Gerry Conway, penciled by Rich Buckler, inked by Romeo Tanghal, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by Ben Oda.
  7. "The Courtship of Captain Nazi" (Captain Marvel and Captain Nazi) written by E. Nelson Bridwell, penciled by Don Newton, inked by Kurt Schaffenberger, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by Ben Oda.

Notes:

  • 64 pages with no ads.
  • Joe Chill, Thomas and Martha Wayne cameo flashback appearances.
  • Rope Arrow, Boomerang Arrow, Exploding Arrow and Smog-Alert Arrow used.
  • Smog-Alert Arrow is composed of dust, ash, sulphur and hydrocarbons.
name: The Curse of Krypton! / The Blood of the Lamb! / One Man Can Cry / Death Orbit / The Courtship of Captain Nazi

description:
The Joker proposes a radical solution to Arkham Asylum's dire situation - gladiatorial combat. Dr. Arkham reluctantly agrees to relieve the tension caused by dwindling supplies and a lack of staff members. He assigns the guards to handle the patients' medication which Joker has manipulated.

Dr. Arkham stumbles upon a staff member's corpse thought to have abandoned the asylum and finds out his keys are missing. The fight begins with Pinhead and Killer Croc who is dosed with stimulants. Inmates begin to start betting on the outcome of the match. When the dust settles, Killer Croc emerges victorious. He goes on a rampage catching the staff off guard.

In the chaos, the inmates seize control and take Dr. Arkham hostage. They demand that he be tortured but the Joker disperses them with a water hose. With Pinhead out of the way, he picks his beef with Wax Man. The Arkham staff regains control of the situation.

With the keys stolen by Joker, Dr. Arkham decides to lock up all inmates in the gym. Dissent grows among the staff with some of them deciding to leave. The doctor locks himself in his office not knowing that the inmates have broken out of the room.
name: Road to No Man's Land - Wax Man and the Clown, Part Two

description: At Arkham, the inmates are running the Asylum in the aftermath of a massive earthquake that rocked Gotham City to its core. Jerimiah Arkham must make a series of horrible decisions.
name: Road to No Man's Land - Wax Man and the Clown, Part 3

description: Asrial and Ichi work on a birthday present for Jeremy; Tomorrow Man and his family move to Quagmire; Superman spoof; Ichi climbs up to the ancestral mountain shrine of her clan to try to claim a legendary ninja sword; Lendo has a problem with opening a sushi restaurant; Kun-Li tries to subdue a mind-controlled Sandie; Street Fighter spoof; cameo spoof: Pakkuman [Pac-Man]; Robo-Tinker helps Ricky get his Christmas wish; Jera'Dib leads an attack on a Rivalkonen steam harvester.
name: Crossroads

description: Barney finds Destructo in his junkyard; Sammi meets the Y-men; an X-Men spoof.
name: Enter: The Y-Men

description: Jeremy tries to save Mimi from being possessed by her black magic powers; Mita Celande decides to leave Quagmire and time travel with Professor Azland.
name: Matters of Belief

description: A prequel to the new HBO series, "True Blood" and based on the Southern Vampire Novels of Charlaine Harris. This comic explores the lead up to the vampires coming out of the coffin and revealing their existence to humanity.
name: The Great Revelation

description: Quagmire residents try to find a way to stop Dorak's invasion of Earth; RoboCop spoof; Cameo spoofs: Ultraman; William Shatner; Lance Ito.
name: Monsters From Space - Part 4: Beans and Nothingness

description: Akaru tries out for the Quagmire Koalas combat cheerleaders; Spoof on Fushigi no umi no Nadia [Secret of the Blue Water]; Cat Terminator tries to catch missing clocks that transform into toy planes. Terminator spoof; Cameo spoofs: Hello Kitty; Mighty Tiny.
name: Boy Meets Girl...Cobra Meets Mongoose!

description: The Earth Defense League try to fight the alien invaders. Sun Vulcan spoof; RoboCop spoof; cameo spoof: Mazinger Z; Ichi and Hazy prepare for their duel.
name: Monsters From Space - Part 2: The End Of The World As We Know It!; Redeemer, Part Two

description: Space beans seek out people who can stop another giant monster invasion; Ichi-Kun and Ricky return to Japan, where Ichi is challenged to a duel by the representative of a samurai clan.
name: Monsters From Space - Part 1: Beanbrains!; Redeemer, Part One

description: An alien cleaning fluid creates havoc at a car wash; cameo spoofs: Wiley Eightball [Wile E. Coyote spoof]; Walter Mitty; Warrior Nun Areala; Hello Kitty; Looney Tunes; Ichi tries to challenge the guardian of a legendary ninja sword.
name: Car Wash Freakin' Monster Rally Thing!; Redeemer, Part Five

description: Lendo and Aloysius go on a quest across Hell to try to rescue Jeremy and Mimi; Mimi responds to the demons' torments by calling on the black magic powers of her family. Professor Azland confesses his love to Mita Celande.
name: Death Perception

description: Dorak starts trying to capture his enemies while Professor Beanhead develops a new bean-powered giant robot; RoboCop spoof; Ichi and Hazy's duel is shown in a line of panels at the top of each page, while the rest of each page is about the aftermath of the duel.
name: Monsters From Space - Part 3: The World Will Be Saved By Beans!!; Redeemer, Part Three

description: Akaru helps the Quagmire Koalas compete at the annual combat cheerleaders championships.
name: Grudge Mismatch

description: Sammi and the Y-men try to stop Destructo's & Barney's plans; Cat Terminator is assigned to locate missing clocks that transform into toy planes; Terminator spoof.
name: What Goes Around, Comes Around

description: Jeremy and Ricky fly to Japan to visit their grandfather.
name: The Girl Who Came In From The Cold

description: Sammi tells the Y-men about Destructo's past; the Y-men become concerned about Destructo's & Barney's plans; Charlie asks if Sammi is also gay; X-Men spoof.
name: Secrets or Everybody's Got Something to Hide
To be or not to be

description: Bishop Olmos and his "foul sons of Marvelian anal leeches" attempt a coup against Princess Leeanna; Zetraman tries to activate the Earth Guardian; Kalen and his crew try to rescue Princess Asrial.
name: The Politics of War

description:
Overview:

The pirate Blackbeard, haunted by the spirit of the man he murdered to gain the map to the Relics of Christ, begins his quest to find these priceless artifacts. Blackbeard's first mate, the traitorous Ichabod Klump, sets his heart on stealing the map and presenting it to his true Captain - Black Bart Roberts.
name: Book 2: Darkness Rising

description:
Overview:

With the map in Black Bart's hands, the race is on between Blackbeard and Bart himself to find the Treasures of God first! Pursued by His Majesty's Navy, the two men must brave death and worse if they are to capture the ultimate prize.
name: Book 3: Treachery and a Dead Man's Pledge

description:
Overview:

Blackbeard's wicked soul has found its just rewards in Hell, while Black Bart holds the treasures of Christ in hand! But an undead army has risen, intent on clutching the relics in rotting hands. Now Black Bart must act fast if he is to survive the undead AND the British Navy!
name: Book 4: Darkness Before the Dawn

description:
Overview:

A professional.

A man of few scruples, nerves of steel, and a steady trigger finger.

A man whose crimes might be catching up with him.

A man on the verge of cracking.
name: Long Fire, Part One

description: His target hasn't shown up, and the waiting is getting to him. He is stuck, reminiscing over past hits and the accumulated blood on his hands.
name: Long Fire, Part Two

description:
Overview:

The Killer takes a nice vacation with his girlfriend to boost his morale but is interrupted by an ancient, unexpected evil
name: Vicious Cycle, Part One

description: A hit gone bad, a dead cop, and your fixer may be double-crossing you... what's a Killer to do?
name: Vicious Cycle, Part Two

description: The Riddler's attempt to settle into a better life turns sour when his girl turns out to be more of a criminal then he is.
name: Riddles

description:
As Underworld Unleashed engulfs the DC Universe, Neron's corrupting influence has intensified the madness and evil already concentrated within the walls of Arkham Asylum. Into this deadly mix comes a new inmate who has poisoned the Asylum's other residents, and the antidote carries a price only Batman can pay...with his soul!

Notes:

  • Ranked #90 in Wizard Magazine's list of "100 Best Single Issue Comics Since You Were Born".
  • For the Spanish translation, see Batman Especial Underworld #1 - Devils Asylum.
name: Arkham: Devil's Asylum

concept_credits.name: 100 Best Single Issue Comics Since You Were Born

first_appearance_concepts.name: 100 Best Single Issue Comics Since You Were Born

name: Hydra Attacks
50 Reasons to Stop Sketcking at Conventions

volume.name: 50 Reasons to Stop Sketching at Conventions

description: The unstoppable villains of the groundbreaking weekly series 52 rise again in this volume collecting the 6-issue miniseries! They are the Four Horsemen - War, Pestilence, Famine, Death - living embodiments of the Dread Ages of the distant world of Apokolips, and they mean to remake the Earth in their own image!
name: TPB

description: The super-powered stars of 52 are featured in this volume collecting the best of their solo stories. Included here are stories from MYSTERIOUS SUSPENSE #1, GOTHAM CENTRAL #40, ANIMAL MAN #16, DETECTIVE COMICS #350, METAL MEN #45, SUPERMAN: THE MAN OF STEEL #97, STRANGE ADVENTURES #226, RIP HUNTER: TIME MASTER #97, SECRET ORIGINS #35 and JSA: SAVAGE TIMES!
name: 52 Companion

description:
Acclaimed artist J.G. Jones delivered on what seemed to be an impossible task — 52 consecutive, weekly covers for 52, DC Comics' biggest project of 2006 — and he delivered in incredible fashion!

Now, readers can enjoy every one of these stunning covers in one volume, complete with commentary by the artist, thumbnail sketches, background information and more. Also included are the covers Jones created for the novel and four 52 collections.
name: Hardcover
Lethal Origins Part 3: Fyre in the Stars

description: Emily Bougue is driven news reporter with a knack for getting into trouble. Brian Fellowes is the best war photographer, and the man in love with Emily, that follows and helps her on her adventures around the world.
name: OGN

description: The deadliest man on earth is having dinner, and you're invited! Just don't be surprised if no one lives to see dessert. An Ancient seal is broken, a terrible curse is laid upon all humanity, and the seven men who might be able to save us all are doing their best to kill each other.
name: Dinner With the Assassin

description: The brothers fight their first battle together, but all does not go according to plan. The Son of Hell explores his new empire, as Zheng the assassin makes his opening moves. More than one family connection is revealed as Seven Brothers continues!
name: Seven Funerals

description: The story of the Seven Brothers rushes towards its conclusion as the Son of Hell makes his play. Rachel's efforts to turn the brothers into fighters have proved fruitless, as the assassin Zhen prepares to finish off what's left of them. One last glimmer of hope remains!
name: The Long Road Home

description: Six hundred years ago, a mighty treasure fleet set out to sail the oceans of the world. They reached every continent, discovered every land long before history's great explorers stole the credit for their feats. Now, in modern day Los Angeles, seven men with nothing in common but their destinies are drawn together in the service of a mysterious young woman. An ancient prophecy must be fulfilled. Something terrible is reaching out across the centuries. There's a world to be saved... and the only hope for us all is a motley crew of so-called brothers and a power too terrifying to be used.
name: Dragonfire

description:
The first graphic novel from superstar action film director John Woo (Face/Off, Mission Impossible: 2). Written by best-selling graphic novel author Garth Ennis. Six hundred years ago long, before history's great explorers stole the credit for their feats, mighty Chinese treasure fleets set sail to reach every continent. These voyages of discovery left behind an evil legacy and a plot by a powerful Chinese sorcerer to dominate the world. Our story begins in modern day Los Angeles where an ancient Chinese prophecy must be fulfilled. Seven men with nothing in common but their destinies must face the Son of Hell to save the world.

Collects Seven Brothers #1-5.
name: John Woo's 7 Brothers!

description: A new Forager arrives in Metropolis in search of Jimmy Olsen--and she brings with her some surprising news about the deceased New Gods. Plus, Karate Kid and Una talk with Brother Eye and Mary Marvel delivers a warped idea of justice across the world.
name: Now, Forager!

description:
Story: "The Blood That Runs" (Director's Cut)

Rachel Kai and the the "Brothers" head to Hong Kong to search for Ronald Wipes who was kidnapped.
name: The Blood That Runs

description: The Challengers battle Lord Havok and the Extremists on Earth-8 while Mary Marvel and Eclipso take on Shadowpact. Meanwhile, the Trickster and Pied Piper look to Two-Face for help--but, naturally, it'll all come down to a flip of a coin!
name: Disasters Great & Otherwise

description: The story of the Seven Brothers rushes towards its conclusion as the Son Of Hell makes his play. Rachel's efforts to turn the brothers into fighters have proved fruitless, as the assassin Zheng prepares to finish off what's left of them. One last glimmer of hope remains...

Meet Gabriel, Jagdish, Daniel, Ronald, Muhammad, Robert and Baz: seven bizarre, but special individuals from all over the world who happen to be descendents of a wizard. They discovered that they?re brothers with a little bit of magic stamped into their DNA. When we saw them last, these Sons of Heaven had defeated the Son of Hell with a little help from their sister, Rachel Kai. Now, this newly found family is having some family issues. Ronald's been kidnapped and the man threatening to take his power is someone from Rachel's past, someone who she was supposed to protect like family. And hell hath no fury, like a brother scorned.

Collects Seven Brothers volume 2 #1-5.
name: The Blood that Runs!

description: In a world where Mayan gods are still worshipped, where bondage is a way of life, where time itself is the private domain of the rich and powerful, there are still laws which must be enforced. Meet Tongue and Lash, the most unusual private investigators in comics history. Hired by a nobleman's daughter to check out her father's mistress, the two are framed for murder when the girl is assassinated. Their investigation leads them to a dark conspiracy which could destroy their entire society.
name: The Serpent's Tooth

description: Tongue and Lash's investigation into the murder of the prostitute, Lilac, takes them to the flesh factories of the Begetters, the mysterious genetic engineers who create the Mayan Lords' man-beast slaves. They then must track the real killer into Metatime, a forbidden dimension of time that exists between the shadows of reality.
name: Serpent's Tooth

description:
All stories come to an end this issue to make way for Prog 1600 next week and an all new roster of stories.

Cover: Dave Taylor (Judge Dredd)

  • Judge Dredd - Blindside (part 4 - final part) (Robbie Morrison - Richard Elson)
  • Bob Byrne's Twisted Tales - Tale 6 (Bob Byrne)
  • Sinister Dexter - The Importance of Fleeing Ernest (part 5 - final part) (Dan Abnett - Anthony Williams)
  • Terror Tales! - Futurity (Arthur Wyatt - Cliff Robinson)
  • Nikolai Dante - Amerika (part 11 - final part) (Robbie Morrison - Simon Fraser)
name: Prog 1599

description:
The spotlight shines on Top Cow founder Marc Silvestri in this very special art collection!

Silvestri’s career blossomed during runs on Uncanny X-Men and Wolverine. In the early 1990s, he revolutionized the comics industry when he co-founded Image Comics and had a hand in creating such hit properties as Cyberforce, Witchblade, and The Darkness. This oversized art book showcases some of Silvestri’s favorite, most popular, and most iconic images from his illustrious career.

Featuring commentaries by Dave Finch, Brandon Peterson, Billy Tan, Mike Choi and Michael Broussard.

We all know Spider-Man's origin - but what happened the day after Uncle Ben died? Find out in Spider-Man: 48 Hours! Also, see the life of MayDay before she became Spider-Girl with Mr. and Mrs. Spider-Man! Also, check out Aunt May, Agent of F.E.A.S.T. and a flashback to the birth of Spidey's nemesis, VENOM!

Story Titles

  • 48 Hours
  • The Amazing Ape-Rachnid Spider-Monkey!: The Final Chapter!
  • Family Ties
  • Aunt May, Agent of F.E.A.S.T., in Birthday Girl
  • Venom (reprinted from ASM #300)
name: 48 Hours; The Amazing Ape-Rachnid Spider-Monkey!: The Final Chapter!; Family Ties; Aunt May, Agent of F.E.A.S.T., in Birthday Girl; Venom

concept_credits.name: With Great Power Comes Great Responsibility

first_appearance_concepts.name: With Great Power Comes Great Responsibility

description:
Special crossover of Underworld Unleashed. 
 
As UNDERWORLD UNLEASHED unfolds on Earth, events on Apokolips have attracted Neron's notice. Following the events in New Gods (1995 4th Series) #1 and #2, Darkseid's lieutenants have become locked in a power struggle with Apokolips itself as the ultimate prize. But with Neron pulling the strings, the ultimate prize also carries the ultimate price.
name: Dark Uprising

description: Special crossover of Underworld Unleashed. Sentinel's wife has been corrupted by Hell itself. He leads a coalition of allies to get her back.
name: Over Dark Evil

description: Special crossover of Underworld Unleashed. Neron tries to see if Barbara Gordon has any knowledge useful to him. And in the meantime, try to corrupt her to his side. He has some powerful temptations, not the least of which is walking again...
name: Patterns of Fear
The Flub Club; Mentor Mismatch; Fast Food Friends?

description:
1. Gotham City-- Ghost City (Batman and Superman / written by Denny O'Neil)

2. Stake Out Earth ( Green Arrow, Black Canary, Hawkman / written by Gerry Conway)

3. Regarding the Winged Wonder (Hawkman, Green Arrow, Black Canary / written by Gerry Conway)

4. The Last Hideout (Black Lightning / written by Denny O'Neil)

5. The Secret of Mr. Tawny (Captain Marvel, Tawky Tawny / written by E. Nelson Bridwell)
Origin of Tawky retold
name: Gotham City-- Ghost City ; Stake Out Earth ; Regarding the Winged Wonder ; The Last Hideout ; The Secret of Mr. Tawny

description:
Doctor Will Magnus is flooded with mail requests to rebuild Platinum. Consumed with loneliness, Platinum had constructed a robot duplicate of Magnus. In turn, the Magnus robot constructed it's own Metal Man, Plutonium, and set it to detonate. To save the world, Platinum wound herself around "Magnus" and Plutonium, binding them together. Next she wound herself around their mobile jet platform, then bound it to a departing rocket. Plutonium detonates on the Moon, destroying itself, Platinum and "Magnus". In order to reconstruct Platinum, Magnus would need to journey to the Moon, to recover vital elements of her makeup. Deeming the task too difficult, Magnus decides to build a brand new Platinum. Correcting for the earlier "flaw" in the responsometer that gave the original Platinum human emotions, Magnus builds the new Platinum as a perfect robot.

The Metal Men greet the new Platinum with warm affection, only to be rebuffed by it's cold, emotionless derision. Believing that Magnus' Metal Men are faulty in their construction, Platinum suggests that Magnus take it out on a trial run. In this way, Platinum can more strongly demonstrate the proper operational parameters for machines. Mercury boils hot in the face of Platinum's assumed superiority. Tin, however, fears that Platinum will convince Magnus to scrap the Metal Men. Magnus departs with Platinum in the Metal Men's jet platform. Upon boarding the craft, Platinum nearly crushes Magnus' foot when she steps upon it. Magnus attempts to impress Platinum with the beautiful spectacle of a magnificent sunset. The Platinum robot is unmoved. A sudden updraft pitches Magnus off the jet platform.

Platinum makes no move to rescue Magnus, until he specifically orders it to catch him. Platinum catches Magnus, after he has already plummeted beneath the surface of the river. Once caught, Platinum merely holds Magnus, instead of pulling him to the surface. Magnus is on the verge of drowning, when he sees Mercury and Iron descending towards him. Mercury brings Magnus back up to the jet platform, where they find Platinum violently resisting the efforts of the other Metal Men to force it to let go of Magnus. Barely conscious, Magnus orders Platinum to release him. Platinum complies. Returning to their headquarters, Magnus orders Platinum to leap into his industrial metal smelter. Magnus, with the Metal Men, journey to the Moon, to recover the necessary elements to rebuild the original Platinum.

Back on Earth, Magnus completes the reconstruction work. A revived Platinum immediately resumes her amorous attentions towards Magnus. When Platinum continues to disrupt Magnus' work on a space catapult craft, Magnus suggests Platinum cook them a meal. Platinum begins to fry some eggs. Suddenly, the eggs violently erupt from the pan, growing to enormous size. Magnus comes to Platinum's rescue, then surmises that the "egg" is really an amoeba. The micro-organism was probably picked up when they brought Platinum's elements back from the Moon. As soon as it was brought to Earth, it awakened from it's dormancy, and attacked. The amoeba, continuing to grow, breaks through the kitchen door. Lead becomes a giant barrier between the amoeba and the the Metal Men, but the amoeba eventually topples Lead.

As the team runs from the amoeba, Tin laments that he is too weak to be of any use to the Metal Men. Iron attacks the amoeba, only to have the creature separate into multiple amoebas, which overwhelm Iron. Mercury forms a final barrier against the amoeba, buying Magnus, and the remaining Metal Men, time to reach the jet platform. As Mercury falls, Magnus attacks the amoeba with the weapons on board the jet platform. The jet platform's weapons array merely transforms the amoeba into a mutated herd of micro-organisms. Tin transforms himself into an enormous tin cup, which Gold then forces the micro-organisms to enter. Platinum then binds Tin to Magnus' space catapult. Magnus takes Tin into orbit, then launches him into a cosmic ray storm, in the hopes that the radiation will destroy the micro-organisms. Platinum is forced to release Tin. As Magnus returns to Earth, Platinum chastises him for so coldly abandoning Tin.
name: The Moon's Invisible Army

description:
Having had to rebuild the Metal Men 29 times, Doctor William Magnus decides to build a second team of Metal Men to serve as replacements for the first. Once completed Magnus gives the new Metal Men over to the old team for training. Gold's replacement is Silver. Iron's is Cobalt. Tin's is Zinc. Lead's is Osmium. Mercury's is Gallium. Platinum's is Iridium. Meanwhile, the disembodied intelligence of Darzz, the Dictator arrives on Earth. The new Metal Men's training is going well, save for Iridium's. Seeing Iridium as a rival for Magnus' affections, Platinum attacks her trainee. Magnus separates the two, harshly chastising Platinum for her actions. As usual, Platinum overreacts, and quits the Metal Men. Platinum encounters the prison bubble of Darzz, the Dictator. Darzz pours on the charm, convincing Platinum to release him from his "false" imprisonment.

Once released from the bubble, Darzz feeds his disembodied intelligence into a statue, animating it. Platinum is taken with the attention Darzz shows her, and decides to return to headquarters, to make Magnus jealous. Darzz moves from the statue into a sports car, then heads into the city. There, Darzz moves from the car into a skyscraper, animating it into a horrifying colossus. Alerted to the trouble, Magnus sees the crisis as the perfect opportunity to send the new Metal Men into the field. The team alloys themselves together, molding themselves into a catapult, from which to hurl the super dense Osmium, at the walking skyscraper. Osmium's impact causes the skyscraper to collapse. Magnus is so impressed with the new Metal Men's performance that he callously praises them over the old Metal Men's proven track record.

The original Metal Men abandon Magnus, in anger, deciding to make their own way in the world. Gold finds work as a Goldsmith, at a local jeweler. Iron takes on a job building bridges. Lead works in a nuclear research center. Tin and Nameless join an assembly line. Mercury uses his amazing abilities to clean out oil pipelines. Platinum finds Darzz in the rubble of the collapsed skyscraper. Darzz moves into a store mannequin, and charms his way into an invitation to visit Magnus' laboratory. There Darzz splits his consciousness a half dozen times, to commandeer the new Metal Men. Magnus and Platinum are locked away, but once alone, Platinum is easily able to effect their escape. Magnus and Platinum gather the original Metal Men back together, and return to the laboratory complex, for the showdown.

Gold destroys Silver by tackling him into a vat of concentrated nitric acid. Iron shatters the more brittle Cobalt. Lead maneuvers the heavier Osmium into crashing through the floor. Mercury leads Gallium into a frigid pipe, freezing his substitute solid. Osmium falls into Magnus' X-ray laboratory, where the strong bombardment of X-Ray's causes Osmium's head to explode. Mercury throws the section of pipe holding Gallium into Magnus' industrial smelter. Tin and Nameless crush Zinc between their harder bodies. Platinum trips Iridium into the industrial smelter. With Iridium's destruction, the disembodied intelligence of Darzz, the Dictator is completely dissipated. With the battle over, Magnus realizes there is only one, true Metal Men.
name: The Amazing School For Robots

description:
Envious of Tin's relationship with Nameless, the other Metal Men ask Doctor William Magnus to build robot girlfriends for them. Magnus, at first, refuses, until Platinum points out that if she had another suitor, she would stop harassing Magnus. In three days time, Magnus has built opposite sex versions of the Metal Men, with the exception of Tin, who already had Nameless. Unfortunately for Magnus, Platinum's new beau spurns her. Magnus is alerted to a massive mechanical juggernaut tearing up the countryside, a prelude to an alien invasion. Both teams of Metal Men respond to the threat. Tin is the first to engage the rolling leviathan, molding himself into a tank barrier.

The humblest Metal Man, though, proves too weak to actually stop the machine menace. Almost immediately, discord between the two teams begins to build. Gold's girl keeps issuing commands before he can. The Irons are ordered to attack, but Iron's girl shows him up, by doing more damage. The Mercurys are sent in to gum up the machine's works. Mercury's girl takes all the credit, belittling his participation. The Leads block the machine's blaster fire, reflecting it back for the final killing blow. Before the mechanism can completely break down, it launches one last missile at the team. Platinum orders the Platinum Man to weave a wire net with her, to catch the projectile.

Turning the metal leviathan over, the team breaks inside to find... nothing. The machine turns out to be a remote controlled drone. There's no sign of the aliens. Returning to headquarters, the Metal Women, including the usually supportive Nameless, walk away from their male counterparts, believing themselves to be superior in every way. The aliens, robot amazons from another world, build their own female robot, as a lure to draw the Metal Men away from the Metal Women. En masse, the Metal Men follow the alluring robot back to the robot amazons. There the robot amazons each use their own individual abilities to subdue the Metal Men. Iron's joints are rusted. Mercury is frozen solid.

Lead is dropped from a great height, and flattens out across the landscape. Gold's head is knocked off by a magnetic fist. Tin is wrapped in knots. Platinum Man's mass is increased, so that he sinks into the ground. The Metal Women decide to make up with the Metal Men, only to find them gone. Gold Girl picks up the scent of the alien robot's perfume, and follows it back to the robot amazons. Discovering Platinum Man rapidly sinking into the Earth, Platinum is told the tactics the robot amazons used to defeat the Metal Men. Mercury Girl is frozen solid, but Iron Girl uses her as a shield to block the hot steam attack, designed to rust Iron Girl's limbs.

The hot steam thaws Mercury Girl out, who then steers Lead Girl into the two amazons, destroying them. Lead Girl gets a solid grip on the ground, so that when she is lifted into the air by Lead's attacker, she merely stretches up. Whipping back down with the robot amazon destroys Lead Girl's attacker. Gold Girl twists the magnetic fist back at the robot amazon that downed Gold, causing her metallic innards to come bursting through her chest. Nameless grabs a large rock, as she is being twisted into knots. Spiraling back to her normal shape, she releases the rock, destroying the robot amazon. Platinum climbs a tree, so that when she is made super heavy, she falls onto the robot amazon, crushing her.

The Metal Women repair the damage done to the Metal Men. To rescue Platinum Man they form a "living" chain to reach him, then begin to pull him up. Suddenly, a flow of molten lava forms a pool beneath Platinum Man. Rather than risk them all being destroyed, Nameless is ordered to let go of Lead Girl, which saves herself and Platinum. The Metal Women, and Platinum Man, are consumed by the lava flow. Magnus offers to rebuild them, but the Metal Men decide that they don't want girlfriends after all. All but Mercury, that is, who is found to be harboring the alien robot the amazons used to lure the Metal Men to them. Unfortunately, for Mercury, that robot has ceased to function.
name: The Metal Women Blues

description:
The Metal Men are on the run from the law. Finally cornered, Lead molds himself into a giant barrier, sacrificing himself so the rest of the team can escape. The police officers open fire on Lead. Using grappling hooks, the police officers begin to scale Lead, never ceasing their attack upon him. Platinum doubles back and nets the police officers, dragging them off Lead, and bringing them back to the ground. Suddenly, an enormous fly appears, and begins to attack the police. As it crushes police cruisers, and entangles officers in it's sticky emissions, the creature identifies itself as "Fferka".

Platinum spreads herself into wire to bind Fferka's limbs, giving Lead the opportunity to pound the creature to death. Upon Fferka's death, it's giant corpse bursts open, releasing a swarm of flies, which all begin growing to enormous size. Lead and Platinum retreat in the face of the insect horde. Regrouping with the other Metal Men, they do their best to stay out of sight and avoid the police patrols. The team is pulled off the street by Colonel David Magnus, the brother of the Metal Men's creator, Doctor William Magnus. Colonel Magnus ferries the team to the United States Army Special Services building.

En Route, they are attacked by a giant fly. The creature reveals that it has traveled to Earth from the doomed planet Ffeexa. Their world's food supply has been exhausted, and thus, they have sent out scouts to raid other worlds for their resources. Colonel Magnus is able to outmaneuver the Ffeexan, and arrive safely at their destination. There, the Metal Men race to their inventor, Doctor Magnus, still comatose from a recent laboratory accident. Colonel Magnus deactivates the Metal Men, with a device given to him by his brother. The Colonel's mind returns to the events that lead them to this dilemma.

His brother had just finished upgrading the power of the Metal Men, when a loose connection in his laboratory equipment electrocuted him. Colonel Magnus was left in charge of the Metal Men. The team were sent out to aid local firefighters in containing a tenement blaze. The Metal Men, however, had not yet adjusted to their power upgrade, and ended up making the situation worse. An attempt to aid the police in stopping some fleeing criminals ended just as badly. The Metal Men were regarded as renegades, and soon found themselves fleeing from the law.

Colonel Magnus reactivates the Metal Men, to deal with the threat from the Ffeexan invaders. In thwarting the invasion, the Metal Men hope to restore their good name. Iron, Lead, Tin and Mercury are immediately entangled in the Ffeexan's sticky emissions. Grabbing a downed power line, Platinum and Gold use the conductive quality of their bodies to channel lethal amounts of electricity into the Ffeexans. Though the aliens are all slain, and the city saved, the police still surround the Metal Men, and level their weapons on them. Back at headquarters, Colonel Magnus grows concerned when he doesn't hear back from the Metal Men.
name: Recipe To Kill a Robot

description:
Despite having saved the city from an alien threat, the Metal Men find themselves surrounded by the police, guns drawn. Suddenly, a chilling new menace appears. The police immediately begin firing on the gigantic, nightmarish figure. Mercury leaps into the fray, only to be shattered into hundreds of individual globules. Mercury's globules roll back into the officers, felling them. A young child moves too close to the conflict. Platinum is quick to return the child to his mother. The haunting creature seizes Platinum, intent on making her it's queen. The fire department joins the battle, firing high pressure jets of water at the horrific apparition. The creature is unfazed, merely turning the water to steam, with a wave of it's hand. When the phantasmal figure steps through the firemen's life nets, the Metal Men swing into action.

Gold molds himself into an enormous cup to catch any falling firefighters. Tin molds himself into the bottom of the cup. The creature tears the firemen from their ladder, but Iron is quick to catch them in the giant metal cup. Impacting the hard metal of the cup, though, injures the firefighters. The police, now believing that the Metal Men are in league with the alien horror, open fire on the team. Lead quickly molds himself into a shield to protect his fellow Metal Men. To Lead's dismay, the bullets ricochet back on the officers. Realizing that mankind will never trust them again, the Metal Men return to their crypt, where they are deactivated. Only Platinum is left behind, still in the crushing grip of her monstrous antagonist. To demonstrate it's great power, the creature puts all the police and firefighters to sleep.

Then it animates all the store mannequins in the city into an army. The mannequins rampage through the streets, destroying everything in sight. The threat to the city becomes so great, that the police call on the Metal Men to save them. Reactivated, the Metal Men hit the streets with a massive flame thrower, and incinerate the mannequin horde. Meanwhile, the eerie creature has carried Platinum to it's spacecraft. As they fly across the globe, Platinum spies a violently erupting volcano. Spinning herself out into platinum wire, Platinum binds the creature, preventing it from controlling their flight. The spacecraft plummets into the volcano, and is quickly consumed. Long moments pass. Then a single hand reaches up from the churning depths of the volcanic inferno. The question, though, is who's hand is it?
name: Death Comes Calling

description:
Platinum clambers up out of a volcano, only to feel her leg grabbed in a vice-like grip. Her nightmarish pursuer has undergone a horrific transformation, becoming a monstrous volcano-like creature. It's temperature seems to rise with every passing second. Platinum fears it will soon reach her melting point. Platinum manages to get the creature to loosen it's grip enough for her to flee. Meanwhile, the Metal Men are fighting a losing battle against a horde of mannequins, rampaging through the city. With their flame throwers spent, the robot band throw themselves against the horde, in a fierce confrontation. Unable to hold them, the Metal Men are forced backwards, and opt to make their last stand in a wax museum. To the Metal Men's dismay, though, the wax figures come to life, and join the mannequin horde. Caught between the two forces, the Metal Men suffersa terrible beating.

Their responsometers begin to malfunction, causing the Metal Men to run amok. Iron is close to destroying Lead, Mercury, and Tin, when their responsometers finally self-repair. Though currently hated and feared by the human populace, the Metal Men, nonetheless, regroup behind the police barricades. Gold offers the police the Metal Men's aid, in presenting a united front against their mutual enemy. Warily, the police agree. The horde of mannequins and wax figures sweep over their position. Despite their valiant fight, neither the police nor the Metal Men can hold the horde back. Lead molds himself into a barrier, to allow the police to retreat to safety. Then the Metal Men heroically throw themselves against the horde. Platinum arrives with the volcanic monster in hot pursuit. Playing on the creature's strange love for her Platinum desperately cries out to it for aid.

Believing the horde is jeopardizing it's one true love, the volcanic creature incinerates the horde. Having ended the crisis, the living furnace demands it's prize... Platinum. As it's temperature continues to rise, the very stones upon the ground begin to smoke. Platinum agrees to accompany the creature, leading it out of the city. Platinum lures the fiery monstrosity to the waterfront, ultimately leading it into the river. Platinum bores down into the river bed, deeper and deeper. The creature follows. Having attained a sufficient depth, Platinum rockets back up to the surface, leaving the creature buried in the icy mire. In it's rage, the immense heat and pressure within the creature build up to an explosive climax. Platinum returns to the Metal Men. Despite their assistance in saving the city, the police order the Metal Men back to their crypt, for deactivation. The Metal Men go along quietly, but their love of humanity has become sorely diminished.
name: Danger--Doom Dummies

description:
Pavitr Prabhakar is having recurring nightmares for the past few nights. Uncle Bhim comforts him and tells him to be strong. Later, Pavitr overhears a conversation between his uncle and aunt Maya about his future studies. Uncle Bhim thinks that Pavitr deserves a chance to complete his studies and they will manage somehow.  
 
After that, they come to Mumbai. Pavitr's first day to school is an unpleasant one. The other students see his rural clothing and taunt him. But another girl, Meera Jain comforts him, saying that she too is from a village. She tells Pavitr to be strong and ignore the rude comments of the other students. 
 
Meanwhile, Mumbai's top crimelord, Nalin Oberoi wants a mystic amulet and will do anything to get it. He is reported that the village where it has been found, is not willing to part with it. Nalin orders the village to be burned and destroyed. 
 
Pavitr meets his uncle on the river bank and tells him about his distressing experience at school. Uncle Bhim tells him that he understands. He tells Pavitr that "

with great power there must also come great responsibility

". 
 
Nalin Oberoi conducts a ritual with the mystic amulet. Shortly afterwards, a ligntning bolt captures Nalin in its path, feeding his body enough power to transform him into the "Green Goblin", a very powerful demon. 
 
That afternoon, Pavitr is running in an effort to escape a group of bad boys, when he runs into a sadhu. The Sadhu transports him into another dimension and tells him the story of the universe. He tells that dark forces are beginning to gather on Earth and the planet will need a saviour. He gifts Pavitr the "power of the spider", and vanishes. Next, Pavitr finds himself standing atop a tall building. He glances at his new red and blue attire, and dons his mask. Quickly he discovers his amazing powers and swings away into the heart of the city. 
 
Pavitr is swinging on web-lines when suddenly he hears a woman cry for help. He halts but prefers to stay out of trouble when he sees the muggers. But his folly is a great one. Uncle Bhim steps into the way of trouble and gets stabbed fatally. Pavitr realizes his mistake and takes off after the gang. He spots them in an autorickshaw and crashes it, bringing them down. So great is Pavitr's rage that he is on the verge of killing them. But that does not happen. He trusses them up and leaves them for the police to find. 
 
Pavitr glances at his dead uncle one last time and climbs atop a tower. He realizes his folly and vows to use his powers for good deeds.
name: Spider-Man: India

description: As Pavitr Prabhakar comes to grips with his new powers--and the murder of his Uncle Bhim--he learns a terrible piece of news that shatters his life even further. Meanwhile, demon-possessed millionaire Nalin Oberoi has set his sights on young Pavitr--and his plans include a certain eight-armed doctor...

Overview

Young Pavitr Prabhakar faces his first super-villain when a friendly neighborhood cricket game is crashed by none other than Doctor Octopus! Once a timid man, now transformed into a multi-handed demon, Doc Ock brandishes an arsenal of supernatural weaponry... and all of it is aimed at India's own Spider-Man.

The epic "Death of Captain America" tale hits its penultimate chapter... and the final battle between the New Captain America and the people who killed Steve Rogers begins here! By the Eisner-Nominated team of Ed Brubaker and Steve Epting.
name: The Man Who Bought America, Part 5

description:
Overview:

Cult favorite Emily the Strange brings her unique brand of dark, dry wit to comics!

Emily has often been a lone voice of sanity in a completely wacky and confusing world, but this time, she seeks and finds the true nature of solitude. With or without her posse of clever black cats, strange spirits, and hip and unexpected guest stars, Emily's got what it takes to truly go it alone.
name: The Alone Issue

description: The Helm, an enchanted artifact of countless legendary heroes, has learned that its latest Chosen One is a chubby, unemployed fantasy addict . . . who lives in his mother's basement. Defying all odds, however, Matt Blurdy managed both to defeat a bloodthirsty hobgoblin and thwart the Helm's scheme to have him killed. Now the hero's training begins in earnest: workouts, retrieval of a magic flaming sword, battles with wraiths, and a showdown with a sorcerer in mortal combat. But when the media starts reporting Matt's victories as murders, an old flame reenters the picture, and true darkness looms on the horizon, even a replica Highlander trench coat might not be enough to save Matt's hide!

SECRET INVASION TIE-IN!

"SACRED INVASION" reaches its cosmos-shattering climax! Hercules leads the ragged remains of his God Squad into desperate battle with the unimaginably powerful Skrull pantheon -- and if they lose, Earth dies!
name: Sacred Invasion, Part 4: Conclusion

description: From the moment Kal-El landed on earth until the end of time, the Time Trapper has sought to erase Superman's impact on the universe. But the Legion of Super-Heroes have always been there to stop him. This time, though, even the Legion won't be enough. The Time Trapper has found the ultimate weapon to carry out his plan – a twisted mirror image of the boy of steel from a parallel Earth long dead: Superboy-Prime! Who will answer the Legion's call for help? Find out here as the Crisis of the 31st century begins!
name: Book One

story_arc_credits.name: Final Crisis: Legion of Three Worlds

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: Final Crisis: Legion of Three Worlds

volume.name: Final Crisis: Legion of Three Worlds

description: It’s Iron Man the way you like him: wracked by guilt and crackling with power! With the Alpha Team out of action, Tony Stark must stop both the nuclear terrorist and the monstrous Overkill Mind -- alone. But even if he can reach the twisted S.H.I.E.L.D. agent at the heart of the Mind, the nation of Kirikhstan may pay an explosive price!
name: With Iron Hands, Part 4 of 4

description:
One of the Duke of Lorraine's ancestors has made a pact with a pagan spirit, and there's no getting out of this bargain!

And Rex Mundi returns to its roots with a brand-new Brother Matthew mystery. A servant girl is brutally murdered in an elite Paris hotel. Mystified by the horrific crime, the Inquisition puts Brother Matthew on the case. Matthew's partner? None other than the cheerful Inquisitor Moricant!

Brother Matthew: Hill of Martyrs will begin in issue 13 and continue completely free online, every week, courtesy of your friends at Dark Horse Comics. Don't miss the opening chapter of another dark, quirky investigation in the annals of Brother Matthew!

* Features the spectacular artwork of Guy Davis and Dave Stewart. Newcomers Brian Churilla and Jason Millet will bring Brother Matthew back to life. There hasn't been a new Brother Matthew story since it debuted online in 2001!
name: Occult Mysteries / Murder in Old France

description: FIND ROMANTIC BLISS AT THE BALL! Love is in the air between Chuck Amok and Donnarama - a match made in Chaos Magic Heaven! But can these star-crossed lovers face up to the realities of an adult relationship? Namely, the Fire Mage known as WRATHBURN! ROMANCE COMICS ARE BACK - BRINGING THEIR UNIQUE MAGIC WITH 'EM!
name: Episode Three

description:
Overview:

Ivory struggles with the practical implications of becoming a vampire, while trying to figure out why it happened. Meanwhile, her best friend abandons her as she returns to the vampire’s underground club on a quest that leads her to the lair of voluptuous vampire villainess, Marie Antoinette.
name: Blue Blood; Fall From Grace

description: At long last, Padawan Zayne Carrick confronts the Jedi Masters who framed him for murder! The prophecy that was seen by Zayne's Masters appears to be coming true. Two pieces of the sequence have come to pass . . . and those who remain alive are still fighting to prevent their vision from becoming a reality. The Jedi Consulars are beginning to doubt themselves and it's possible they have overlooked a true source of danger!. Until Now
name: Vindication, Part 1

volume.name: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic

description: To be or not to be in The Atomics? That is the question. Recent changes in the team lineup is shaking up Frank "Madman" Einstein and cosmic repercussions are at stake. Plus what happened to the guy from the cable company?! Why is he so late?! Shouldn't he have shown up by now?
name: Knowledge Comes With Death's Release

description: This month in TRINITY: The Justice League joins Superman, Batman and Wonder Woman to stand against the threat that the Crime Syndicate brings to Earth. And, in this month's co-features, members of Batman's "family" search for clues to what ties several thefts together – and what links them to the cosmic conflict that has resulted!
name: 100101010; Riddle me this

description:
Overview:

X-Factor is in pursuit of Darwin, whose father is looking for him. She-Hulk and Jazinda are in pursuit of Longshot, who may hold the key to defeating the Skrull invasion. With Darwin and Longshot on the run, neither of them wanting to be found, you'd just assume that X-Factor and She-Hulk will work together smoothly to accomplish both their goals. But what fun would that be?
name: The Darwin Awards, Part 3

description:
Overview:

Revealed here are the origins of Darth Vader's secret apprentice, the deadly missions on which he was sent to track down and destroy Jedi, and the awesome decision he is forced to make that will, literally, change the way you look at the Star Wars saga!
name: TPB

description:
Overview:

Vixen's power issues come to the forefront as Vixen, Black Canary, Zatanna, Hal and The Flash pay a visit to Animal Man. The team must team up with Animal Man to battle a new Justice League villain – and at stake is control of the Tantu Totem!
name: The Second Coming, Chapter Three: The Blood-Dimmed Tide
